pages.text: Saltriovenator is a ceratosaur from the Early Jurassic. The name of the animal comes from the place of its discovery, since it was found in the area around Saltrio in Italy, in the Salnova marble quarry.

Originally discovered in 1996, the animal would remain unnamed, aside form the unofficial name "Saltriosaur", up until 2018, when it was formally described. The remains of the animal are not incredibly complete, which lead to several interpretations of the potential life appearance it might have had.
